text: Greg Glasson with Seal "System" Tour Gregory Scott Glasson (born December 6, 1974) is an American bass player. He has played bass for Grammy Award winning artist Seal both live onstage and in studio recordings.Rebecca Hamm. "Locals to jam with Seal in Las Vegas", Foster's Daily Democrat, January 16, 2008. Retrieved on 2008-05-14. Glasson is also widely known as a solid session player, and has been featured on numerous albums, for a variety of artists. Mostly sought after in the Pop rock field, Glasson has played on major label tracks for artists such as Seal, Alanis Morissette and producer Josh Harris.Distortion on the Dance Floor (edits) mp3s, Distortion on the Dance Floor (edits) music downloads, Distortion on the Dance Floor (edits) songs from eMusic.com Born in Princeton, New Jersey, Glasson grew up in Pennington, New Jersey and graduated from Hopewell Valley Central High School. At the age 19 he was on the road playing with 90's roots rock act Dear Liza opening for Blues Traveler on their multiplatinum Four tour, as well as extensive tours with Derek Trucks Band and a handful of dates on the traveling 90's festival H.O.R.D.E.BluesTraveler.net Setlist Search Results A decade of touring and recording led to more session work for major labels and indie bands in NH. Greg currently plays full-time with Mother Superior & The Sliding Royales and Tan Vampires.Gregg Glasson Official website. title: Gregory S. Glasson
